reason: Consequence (iii): The justification that P_n is open via 'disc(p) > 0 on P_n and disc is continuous' is INCOMPLETE. The set {disc > 0} is indeed open, and P_n is contained in it, but {disc > 0} is NOT equal to P_n for n >= 4 (e.g., a degree-4 polynomial with two complex conjugate pairs also has disc > 0). The correct argument requires noting that P_n is a connected component of {disc \!= 0}, or that roots depend continuously on coefficients and real-distinctness is open by the implicit function theorem. The definition itself and consequences (i)-(ii) are correct; only the openness justification has a gap.
